articles.title: Another Unilateral Anti-DPRK Sanctions of U.S. under Fire
articles.content:
Another Unilateral Anti-DPRK Sanctions of U.S. under Fire
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A spokesperson for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK) gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA on January 27 as regards the U.S. announcement on another unilateral sanctions against the DPRK:
					 The U.S. Treasury Department announced on January 24 that it would enforce sanctions on more than ten individuals, several entities and vessels under an allegation that those designated violated its "sanctions laws".
					
					 The unilateral sanctions of the U.S. are an extension of its hostile policy to strangle the DPRK at any cost by means of sanctions and pressure accompanied by the military threats and also a manifestation of heinous intention to throw a wet blanket over the inter-Korean exchange and cooperation and to aggravate the situation.
					
					 The U.S. pursuit of unilateral sanctions under its so-called "sanctions laws" constitutes wanton violation of the universally recognized international laws which underline that in no case can a sovereign state be an object of jurisdiction of other country, and it is also an obvious infringement upon sovereignty and a grave act of provocation.
					
					 It is indescribably stultifying and ludicrous that the U.S. would still resort to sanctions, turning a blind eye to the prevailing reality that the DPRK has now possessed, amid the ever harshest sanctions and pressure, a powerful nuclear deterrent capable of thwarting and countering any nuclear threats of the imperialist aggression forces.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to awake right away from absurd way of thinking and come to its senses, and give up the anachronistic policy hostile to the DPRK and terminate the provocative acts of aggravating situation on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Ministry Delegation Leaves for Sweden
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Ministry Delegation Leaves for Sweden
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Foreign Ministry led by Vice-Minister Han Song Ryol left here Saturday to visit Sweden.
					 The delegation will have an exchange of views with the Swedish side on bilateral relations and DPRK-EU relations.

articles.title: Our Advance Team Visits South Side's Area for Field Survey
articles.content:
Our Advance Team Visits South Side's Area for Field Survey
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- An advance team led by Yun Yong Bok, vice department director of the Ministry of Physical Culture and Sports, visited the south side's area for field survey on Jan. 25-27 as regards the DPRK's participation in the 23rd Winter Olympics.
					 The 8-person advance team learned about the situation, going round the places to be used by the DPRK National Olympic Committee delegation, players team, cheering group, Taekwon-do demonstration group and press corps during the Olympics.

articles.title: MOU Signed between DPRK and Iran
articles.content:
MOU Signed between DPRK and Iran
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A 2018-2021 memorandum of understanding between the governments of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the Islamic Republic of Iran on cooperation in the fields of culture, art, education, mass media, sports and youth was signed in Teheran of Iran on Jan. 24.
					 DPRK Ambassador to Iran Kang Sam Hyon and Vice-Chairman for International Affairs of the Islamic Culture and Relations Organization of Iran Abbas Khamehyar signed the document respectively.

articles.title: Remodeling of Samjiyon County Progresses Apace in DPRK
articles.content:
Remodeling of Samjiyon County Progresses Apace in DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- It has been pushed forward in the DPRK to spruce up Samjiyon County.
					 According to an official concerned, the 216 Division, ministries, national institutions and relevant industrial establishments have made innovations in turning Samjiyon County into a model and icon one of the whole country and a mountainous city to be the envy of the world.
					
					 In step with the completion of designs for educational quarter, residential quarter, sports facility quarter, sports tourism quarter, open-air park quarter and industrial quarter to be built according to the general plan for remodeling the county, the field headquarters is giving priority to the production of building materials like cement block.
					
					 Taking the lead in block production campaign are the Paektusan Hero Youth Brigade and the Ryanggang Provincial Brigade which built hardening grounds with good heating system as required by the cold weather in the northern part of the country.
					
					 The Hyesan-Samjiyon Railway Construction Brigade is carrying out the interior decoration of railway stations and their auxiliary buildings on a high level and ensuring the test run of train in winter. It also concentrates its manpower and equipment on the construction of dwelling houses for evacuees from the vicinity of the Hyesan-Samjiyon railway, while making full preparations for the second-stage project.
					
					 Ministries, national institutions and relevant industrial establishments have paid primary attention to the cement production, transportation and supply of equipment and building materials for the construction of Samjiyon County.
					
					 In close cooperation with the 216 Division, the railway sector affords preference to the transportation of cement, steel materials and building fixtures.
					
					 In his New Year Address, respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un set forth the task to push ahead with major construction projects including the renovation of Samjiyon County.

articles.title: KCNA Discloses Motive of U.S. Story about "Nuclear Missile Threat" from DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Discloses Motive of U.S. Story about "Nuclear Missile Threat" from DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The U.S. CIA director nowadays claims that he is making "various options" for the president, while talking about the DPRK's nuclear strike capabilities.
					 In an interview with U.S. CBS on Jan. 22, he said: north Korea is to delivering a nuclear attack on the United States in few months. The U.S. government is working diligently to extend that timeline. But the core risk that the policymakers needed to know was that north Korea's nuclear weapons program is continuing to expand, advance, become more powerful, more capable, more reliable.
					
					 He, in a lecture in Washington D.C. on Jan. 23, uttered that the logical next step of north Korea would be to develop the capacity to deliver from multiple firings of ballistic missiles simultaneously. He added that it might put nuclear missile technology for auction to earn money and that various options would be presented to the president in case it is impossible to settle north Korea's issue in a diplomatic manner.
					
					 It is ill-boding that the U.S. is building up public opinion about the story of "nuclear and missile threat" from the DPRK at a time when high-ranking officials of the U.S. political circle and administration were openly making reckless remarks on the military options against the DPRK.
					
					 This is a revelation of the sinister intention of the Trump group to turn back the climate of reconciliation between the north and the south of Korea at any cost and focus international attention on the DPRK's "denuclearization" once again as it is an expression of the U.S. displeasure with the reality in which the situation is heading towards detente and peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The world is sincerely pleased to see the climate of reconciliation and cooperation on the peninsula created by the proactive and magnanimous decision of the DPRK and hope that the coming Winter Olympics would become an occasion of peace and reconciliation.
					
					 However, on the contrary to this, the U.S. is making desperate efforts to chill the hard-won climate of detente on the peninsula.
					
					 It deliberately strains the situation while massively introducing nuclear carrier task forces such as Carl Vinson, Ronald Reagan and Stennis and nuclear war hardware including B-2 and B-52 in the vicinity of the Korean Peninsula, and it is mulling putting brake on the positive development of the situation while crying out for tightening sanctions against the DPRK.
					
					 Shortly ago, the U.S. called for enhancing the efficiency of the U.S.-led strategy of maximum pressure such as "sea blockade" at the so-called "foreign ministers' meeting" of the countries that were defeated in the Korean War held in Canada.
					
					 Against such background, the U.S. CIA director tries hard to build up public opinion about the story of "nuclear and missile threat" from the DPRK every day. The U.S. purpose is to drive the international community to sanctions and pressure against the DPRK by branding the latter as the "provocateur" and block the advance of the warming inter-Korean relations.
					
					 All facts clearly prove that what the U.S. wants is not detente and peace on the Korean Peninsula but escalation of tension and war.
					
					 The international community would be well advised to see properly who truly wants peace in the Korean Peninsula and the region and who is the arch criminal threatening world peace and stability.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Urges U.S. to Withdraw Hostile Policy toward DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Urges U.S. to Withdraw Hostile Policy toward DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The world is urging the U.S. to withdraw the anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK and opt for co-existence with the DPRK, while giving wide publicity to the personality of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un as a great man who raised the strategic position of the country.
					 The U.S. magazine Paste in an article on Jan 17 wrote that the U.S. lost in the stand-off with north Korea over Olympic games and the nuclear issue, adding that leader Kim Jong Un is putting to use the peace card, the most powerful weapon in the region. It also said that the U.S. hinges on decision of the north Korean leader, who may end the confrontation any time he wants and would pursue several peace initiatives, commenting that in the end the U.S. will be made to co-exist with north Korea just as it does with Russia and China which level their nuclear weapons at it.
					
					 The Indian newspaper Ocean News Point, the Iranian Ilna and other media praised Kim Jong Un as the most ideal state leader of the present times possessed of the excellent qualifications and traits and a leader strong in faith, pluck and independence.
					
					 The Turkish newspaper Hurriyet Daily News, Australia's press website Interpreter and China's Hong Kong Economic Journal, too, carried articles saying that north Korean nuclear weapons will, in fact, bring stability to Northeast Asia, because nuclear weapons would reduce misjudgment and prevent conflict from expanding.
					
					 As known, today when the situation on the Korean peninsula has entered the track of detente thanks to the proactive measure taken by the DPRK, the U.S. is trying hard to turn the table, regarding the positive development as a thorn in the flesh, even though it clamored for peaceful solution of the Korean peninsula issue.
					
					 Provocative remarks are openly heard from high-ranking officials of the U.S. political circle and administration. They assert "now time has come for the U.S. to put the north into disadvantages and hold initiatives", "the present trend whereby the U.S. is held back by the north's appeasement policy must be reversed" and that "the Trump administration is taking very serious examination of the military option toward the north".
					
					 The U.S. is putting to the extreme political and military pressure on the DPRK while hurling huge aggression troops including all sorts of sophisticated nuclear war lethal means to the sky, land and sea.
					
					 The U.S. should not make misjudgment.
					
					 It should face up to the fixed will of the Korean nation for independent reunification and the powerful force for safeguarding peace and make reasonable and rational option for itself after refraining from indiscreet provocative adventures, though belatedly.
					
					 A priority for it is to repeal the anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: U.S. and Its Followers Advised to Mind Their Own Business: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
U.S. and Its Followers Advised to Mind Their Own Business: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- Recently a young man of Britain was reportedly indicted on charges of hacking e-mails of chiefs of U.S. information services and over 20 000 employees of FBI and disclosing them.
					 This case embarrassed the U.S. and its vassal forces which used to claim that cyber attacks were "deeds of north Korea".
					
					 Last year Britain connected a cyber attack with the DPRK, in a far fetched way, when the cyber attack crippled hundreds of thousands of computers linked to the system of national public health, making it impossible to give medical aid to more than 19 000 patients.
					
					 At that time some experts alleged that they found signs of north Korea's involvement, adding that the code used in the cyber attack was much like that in the previous hacking cases that seemed to be done by Pyongyang.
					
					 Notably, a British official sniped at Pyongyang for its involvement in the cyber attack, claiming that the British government was sure that north Korea was behind the case.
					
					 In this regard, the DPRK, which gives top priority to the life and health of the people, made clear that it doesn't make sense that the DPRK conducted such cyber attack targeting the health system of Britain. And it officially informed the UK side that its act of unilaterally finding fault with the DPRK without any evidence was a scheme to tarnish the image of the DPRK.
					
					 Whenever cyber attacks take place worldwide, the U.S. and other hostile forces mislead the public, linking the cases with the DPRK for no ground.
					
					 As a matter of fact, the kingdom of cyber crimes is the U.S. and it is also the U.S. that regards the cyber attack as an important tool for its foreign policy.
					
					 The cyber space is means for preemptive attack which the U.S. attaches importance to for the realization of its strategy for hegemony, as well as nuclear stick and dollars.
					
					 The U.S. has regarded the cyber space as the 5th domain for the global domination next to sky, land, sea, outer space from long ago and organized units specializing in cyber warfare in the 1990s.
					
					 Its cyber attack target includes the whole world ranging from anti-U.S. independent countries such as the DPRK to potential rivals like Russia and China, competitor allies and even henchmen.
					
					 When the Sony Pictures Entertainment was hacked in 2014, the U.S. imposed harsher sanctions on the DPRK to stifle it, calling it a hacking criminal, but the truth behind the plot was disclosed through a joint investigation of world-famous information security enterprises.
					
					 The U.S. and its followers such as Britain had better mind their own businesses rather than provoking other countries over cyber attack.

articles.title: Policy of Pressure against DPRK Is Doomed to Failure
articles.content:
Policy of Pressure against DPRK Is Doomed to Failure
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- Tillerson and other riffraff of the U.S. Department of State are now claiming that they "welcome" the inter-Korean dialogue but it is necessary to put persistent pressure upon the DPRK and the U.S. will pursue a policy of "maximum pressure".
					 Japanese Prime Minister Abe, during his recent junkets to European countries, begged for sanctions and pressure on the DPRK. Shortly ago, delegates of the countries that participated in the Korean War and Japan were closeted over intensified pressure against the DPRK in Canada, under the U.S. scenario.
					
					 Commenting on the facts, Rodong Sinmun Saturday says it is not particular that the U.S. and its followers talk about sanctions and pressure against the DPRK from the beginning of the year.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It was a miscalculation of the U.S. that the DPRK would surrender like some countries that destroyed their hard-gained war deterrence, yielding to its persistent sanctions, pressure, military threat and blackmail.
					
					 However, the army and people of the DPRK have made eye-opening successes on all fronts of building a powerful socialist country by giving vent to their soaring hatred against enemies and enthusiasm for retaliating against them despite the harshest sanctions.
					
					 The reality clearly proves that no sanctions, blockade and military pressure of the U.S. can ever check the dynamic advance of Juche Korea based on the spirit of self-reliance and self-development.
					
					 The U.S. hostile policy and sanctions against the DPRK are, in a nutshell, bound to go bankrupt.
					
					 It is ridiculous that the U.S. and its followers talk about "additional and unilateral sanctions" as they have no economic dealings and contact with the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. and S. Korean Regime's Moves to Stifle DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. and S. Korean Regime's Moves to Stifle DPRK
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the south Korean authorities held the second high-level meeting of the diplomatic and defense council for carrying out the extended deterrent strategy in Washington recently.
					 The meeting decided to further intensify the two sides' cooperation for extended deterrence in order to settle the "nuclear issue". It also discussed such issues as constant rotation deployment of the U.S. strategic assets in south Korea and its vicinity under the pretext of "nuclear and missile threat" of someone.
					
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Saturday says:
					
					 The said meeting is just offending as it is aimed to tighten cooperation in stifling the DPRK, only to chill the atmosphere of improving the north-south relations.
					
					 Historically, the U.S., displeased with any sign of improving north-south relations and detente on the Korean peninsula, always poured cold water on such development.
					
					 What matters is the behavior of the south Korean authorities going against the desire of the nation for reunification at the U.S. beck and call.
					
					 Now the south Korean authorities persist in stoking military confrontation to do harm to the compatriots in the north, pursuant to the U.S. policy aimed to hamstring the efforts for detente on the Korean peninsula and repair of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Right after the meeting the south Korean military talked about earlier establishment of the "triad strike system" for tackling someone's "nuclear and missile threat", regular deployment of U.S. strategic assets and tightened military cooperation with the U.S.
					
					 Now is the time for the authorities of south Korea to behave more reasonable than ever before.
					
					 They should know that such ill-intended military confab with the U.S. is just a foolish act of pouring water on the spark of the improved north-south relations and ruining their destiny.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams S. Korean FM's Act of Treachery
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams S. Korean FM's Act of Treachery
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- South Korean Foreign Minister Kang Kyong Hwa let out a load of rubbish at the recent foreign ministers' meeting sponsored by the U.S. in Canada to tighten the siege to the DPRK.
					 She said that they would "explore a way for denuclearization dialogue," asserting that the "settlement of the nuclear issue" should be done before anything else. At an earlier phone conversation with the U.S. secretary of State, she talked about "simultaneous acceleration of the settlement of the nuclear issue of the north."
					
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Saturday says:
					
					 What Kang uttered only revealed the sinister design of the south Korean regime to actively join in the U.S.-led cooperation for stifling the DPRK.
					
					 It is just a disgrace to the Korean nation and an act of treachery that Kang betrayed the wild ambition for stifling the compatriots in the north, hyping the internal issue of the nation in a foreign country.
					
					 It is a lesson taught by history that foreign interference makes the settlement of the nation's issue more complicate and difficult.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should think twice about awful results to be caused by their ugly behavior. They should approach the settlement of the nation's issue with reason, though belatedly.

articles.title: Struggle against Conservatives' Reckless Deeds in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle against Conservatives' Reckless Deeds in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- Various circles of south Korea are intensifying the struggle against the reckless acts of the conservative group chilling the climate of mending the north-south relations.
					 They branded as a heinous traitor Ra Kyong Won of the "Liberal Korea Party" who submitted to the International Olympic Committee a document opposing the formation of inter-Korean unified team. And they staged a signature campaign to demand her dismissal from membership of the organizing committee of the Winter Olympics.
					
					 The signature campaign, which started on Jan. 20, was joined by more than 230 000 people as of Jan. 24.
					
					 The Seoul citizens' committee for welcoming the Pyongchang-Peace Olympics, which consists of 56 civilian organizations, held a news conference near the office of Ra Kyong Won on Jan. 24 to criticize her crime.
					
					 On the same day the Solidarity for the People's Sovereignty launched a campaign outside the Namdaemun police station in Seoul to denounce Jo Won Jin, representative of the "Korean Patriotic Party", and other conservatives who burned the DPRK flag and the Korean Peninsula flag while daring to insult the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership.

articles.title: Hospital Fire Causes Heavy Casualties in S. Korea
articles.content:
Hospital Fire Causes Heavy Casualties in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A fire reportedly broke out at a hospital in Milyang City, South Kyongsang Province of south Korea on Friday.
					 40-odd patients were found dead and at least 70 seriously or slightly wounded.
					
					 Earlier, there was a high-profile disaster in Jechon City, North Chungchong Province of south Korea in December last year, which caused 60-odd casualties.

articles.title: S. Korea: Students Demand Improvement of Education System
articles.content:
S. Korea: Students Demand Improvement of Education System
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- Members of the preparatory committee for the university students council's network of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on January 23, urging the authorities to improve the system of the committee for deliberation on registration fee at universities, according to the south Korean online paper Jaju Sibo.
					 Noting that the students are ignorant of the details of the budget and accounts settlement, a press release blamed the committee for not opening to public the relevant information but offering misinformation.
					
					 Registration fee paid by the students should be deliberated by themselves, it stressed.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated by Koreans in China
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the General Association of Koreans in China for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed on Jan. 24.
					 Choe Un Bok, chairwoman of the association, was elected chairwoman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful events including meeting, film show and art performance praising Kim Jong Il's revolutionary career and exploits.
					
					 The Zhongnan Regional Association, the Yanbian Regional Association and other organizations under the General Association of Koreans in China, too, decided to hold various events.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Introduced in Zimbabwe
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Introduced in Zimbabwe
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- The Zimbabwean newspaper The Herald carried the full text of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's New Year Address with his photo on Jan. 8.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Iran
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Marked in Iran
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the 76th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il was formed by the Islamic Coalition Party of Iran on Jan. 16.
					 A vice general secretary of the Islamic Coalition Party of Iran was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from Jan. 16 to Feb. 18 and decided to hold colorful political and cultural events praising the exploits of Kim Jong Il and conduct brisk activities introducing the proud successes made by the Korean army and people under the wise guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Czech Republic
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Czech Republic
 Pyongyang, January 27 (KCNA) -- A Czech preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Prague on Jan. 9.
					 Jozef Servista, first vice-chairman of the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set a celebration period from Jan. 20 to Feb. 20 and decided to hold diverse political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il in the period.

articles.title: Portavoz del MINREX denuncia nueva medida de sancion anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Portavoz del MINREX denuncia nueva medida de sancion anti-RPDC de EE.UU. 
Pyongyang, 27 de enero (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que EE.UU. volvio a tomar la medida de sancion independiente contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio este sabado a la ACNC la siguiente respuesta:
					El pasado dia 24, el Departamento de Tesoro de EE.UU. anuncio que aplicara la sancion a mas de 10 funcionarios y varios organos y barcos de la RPDC bajo el pretexto de violacion de la "ley de sancion" de su pais. 
					
					Esta farsa significa la continuacion de la politica de hostilidad a la RPDC para atropellarla a toda costa mediante la amenaza militar y la campana de sancion y presion y una expresion del malsano intento de impedir el proceso de intercambio y cooperacion entre ambas partes coreanas y agravar la situacion.
					
					El presente alboroto de sancion independiente infringe flagrantemente la universal ley internacional, segun la cual un Estado soberano no puede ser en ningun caso el blanco del poder judicial de otro pais. Pues, resulta una evidente violacion de la soberania y grave provocacion. 
					
					Es muy ridiculo EE.UU. que recurre todavia a la sancion anti-RPDC sin ver el hecho de que esta preparo a pesar de la inaudita campana de sancion y presion el poderoso disuasivo nuclear capaz de frustrar cualquier tipo de amenaza nuclear de las fuerzas agresoras imperialistas.
					
					Aunque tardiamente, EE.UU. debe volverse en si liberandose del necio modo de pensar, cancelar la anacronica politica hostil a la RPDC y parar los actos provocativos que exacerban la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Sale de Pyongyang la delegacion del MINREX con rumbo a Suecia
articles.content:
Sale de Pyongyang la delegacion del MINREX con rumbo a Suecia
Pyongyang, 27 de enero (ACNC) -- Partio el dia 27 de esta capital la delegacion del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, encabezada por el viceministro Han Song Ryol, para realizar una visita a Suecia.
					La delegacion intercambiara con la parte sueca las opiniones referentes a las relaciones bilaterales y a las RPDC-UE.

articles.title: Grupo norteno de avanzada visita zonas de la parte Sur
articles.content:
Grupo norteno de avanzada visita zonas de la parte Sur
Pyongyang, 27 de enero (ACNC) -- En relacion con la participacion en los 23o Juegos Olimpicos Invernales, el grupo norteno de avanzada para el recorrido en el terreno, encabezado por el subdirector del Ministerio de Deportes, Yun Yong Bok, visito del dia 25 al 27 las zonas de la parte Sur. 
					El grupo compuesto por 8 miembros recorrio los lugares donde actuaran la delegacion del Comite Olimpico Nacional, los grupos de jugadores, hinchas, de demostracion de Taekwondo y periodistas de la parte Norte durante el periodo de la cita deportiva y averiguo la situacion.

articles.title: Rubricado memorando de entendimiento Corea-Iran para el periodo 2018-2021
articles.content:
Rubricado memorando de entendimiento Corea-Iran para el periodo 2018-2021 
Pyongyang, 27 de enero (ACNC) -- Quedo firmado el dia 24 en Teheran, Iran, el memorando de entendimiento 2018-2021 sobre la cooperacion en los dominios de cultura, arte, educacion, comunicacion masiva, deportes y juventud entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y de la Republica Islamica de Iran. 
					Suscribieron el documento el embajador coreano en Iran, Kang Sam Hyon, y el vicepresidente para Asuntos Internacionales de la Organizacion de Cultura y Relaciones Islamicas de Iran, Abbas Khamehyar.
